citeinfo.origin: Digital Social Science Center (DSSC), Columbia University Libraries
Bronx (New York, N.Y.).; Office of the President.; Topographic Bureau.
citeinfo.title: Map or Plan of that Part of the Borough of the Bronx, City of New York, Lying Easterly of the Bronx River : compiled from surveys made under the direction of the Commissioner of Street Improvements of the 23 & 24 wards, and the Board of Public Improvements, 1902

pubinfo.publish: Office of the President of the Borough of the Bronx,

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the 1902 paper map entitled: Map or Plan of that Part of the Borough of the Bronx, City of New York, Lying Easterly of the Bronx River : compiled from surveys made under the direction of the Commissioner of Street Improvements of the 23 & 24 wards, and the Board of Public Improvements. All 6 sheets of the map were scanned at 300 dots per inch and are in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. These images may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: 1 map : col. ; on 6 sheets 78 x 56 cm. Scale [ca. 1:7200]. At head of title: Office of the President of the Borough of the Bronx, Topographic Bureau.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.
